cli-tool.name: CLI Tool
cli-tool.description: Template for command-line tools and utilities

fields.name: MAIN_COMMAND_DESCRIPTION
fields.label: Main Command Description
fields.placeholder: Processes files according to the specified configuration.

fields.name: MAIN_COMMAND_OPTIONS
fields.label: Main Command Options
fields.placeholder:
- `-o, --output <dir>`: Output directory
- `-f, --format <type>`: Output format (json, yaml)
- `-v, --verbose`: Enable verbose logging
fields.help: Available options for the main command

fields.name: MAIN_COMMAND_EXAMPLES
fields.label: Main Command Examples
fields.placeholder:
my-cli process file1.txt file2.txt -o ./output
my-cli process *.txt --format json --verbose
fields.help: Usage examples for the main command

fields.name: ADDITIONAL_COMMANDS
fields.label: Additional Commands
fields.placeholder:
#### `init`

Initializes a new project configuration.

```bash
my-cli init [project-name]
```

#### `config`

Manages configuration settings.

```bash
my-cli config set <key> <value>
my-cli config get <key>
```
fields.help: Other commands available in the CLI

fields.name: GLOBAL_OPTIONS
fields.label: Global Options
fields.placeholder:
- `-h, --help`: Show help information
- `-V, --version`: Show version number
- `--config <path>`: Specify config file path
- `--no-color`: Disable colored output

fields.name: EXAMPLE_1_DESCRIPTION
fields.label: Example 1 Description
fields.placeholder: This command processes the input.txt file and saves the result to the output/ directory.
fields.help: Explanation of what the first example does

fields.name: EXAMPLE_2_DESCRIPTION
fields.label: Example 2 Description
fields.placeholder: Processes all .txt files in the current directory, outputs in JSON format, and shows detailed logging.
fields.help: Explanation of what the second example does

fields.name: MORE_EXAMPLES
fields.label: More Examples
fields.placeholder:
### Example 3: Advanced Configuration

```bash
my-cli process data/ --config custom.json --parallel 4
```

Processes all files in the data/ directory using a custom configuration file with 4 parallel workers.

fields.name: ENV_VARIABLES
fields.label: Environment Variables
fields.placeholder:
- `MY_CLI_CONFIG`: Path to configuration file
- `MY_CLI_OUTPUT`: Default output directory
- `MY_CLI_VERBOSE`: Enable verbose mode (true/false)

fields.name: TROUBLESHOOTING
fields.label: Troubleshooting
fields.placeholder:
### Command not found

If you get a "command not found" error:

1. Ensure the package is installed globally
2. Check that your PATH includes npm global bin directory
3. Try reinstalling: `npm uninstall -g my-cli && npm install -g my-cli`

api-service.name: API Service
api-service.description: Template for REST APIs, microservices and backend services

fields.name: AUTHENTICATION_TYPE
fields.label: Authentication Type
fields.placeholder:
This API uses JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authentication.

To authenticate:
1. Obtain a token from `/auth/login`
2. Include it in the Authorization header: `Bearer <token>`

fields.name: ENDPOINT_CATEGORY_1
fields.label: First Endpoint Category
fields.help: Name of the first API endpoint category

fields.name: ENDPOINT_1_METHOD
fields.label: Endpoint 1 Method
fields.help: HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)

fields.name: ENDPOINT_1_DESCRIPTION
fields.label: Endpoint 1 Description
fields.placeholder: Retrieves a list of all users in the system.

fields.name: ENDPOINT_1_PARAMETERS
fields.label: Endpoint 1 Parameters
fields.placeholder:
- `page` (integer, optional): Page number (default: 1)
- `limit` (integer, optional): Items per page (default: 10, max: 100)
- `search` (string, optional): Search term for filtering users

fields.name: ENDPOINT_1_EXAMPLE
fields.label: Endpoint 1 Example
fields.help: Complete example of how to call this endpoint

fields.name: MORE_ENDPOINTS
fields.label: More Endpoints

fields.name: ENV_VARIABLES
fields.label: Environment Variables
fields.placeholder:
```bash
# Database
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/mydb

# JWT
JWT_SECRET=your-super-secret-jwt-key
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=24h

# Server
PORT=3000
NODE_ENV=development

# Redis (optional)
REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379
```

fields.name: DATABASE_SETUP
fields.label: Database Setup
fields.placeholder:
1. Create a PostgreSQL database:
   ```sql
   CREATE DATABASE myapi;
   ```

2. Run migrations:
   ```bash
   npm run migrate
   ```

3. Seed the database (optional):
   ```bash
   npm run seed
   ```

fields.name: API_TEST_EXAMPLE
fields.label: API Test Example
fields.placeholder:
# Using curl
curl -X GET https://api.example.com/v1/health

# Using HTTPie
http GET https://api.example.com/v1/health

# Run integration tests
npm run test:api
fields.help: Examples of how to test the API

fields.name: DEPLOYMENT_INSTRUCTIONS
fields.label: Deployment Instructions
fields.placeholder:
### Deploy to Heroku

1. Create a Heroku app:
   ```bash
   heroku create my-api
   ```

2. Set environment variables:
   ```bash
   heroku config:set NODE_ENV=production
   heroku config:set JWT_SECRET=your-secret
   ```

3. Deploy:
   ```bash
   git push heroku main
   ```

fields.name: SECURITY_NOTES
fields.label: Security Notes
fields.placeholder:
## Security Best Practices

- All endpoints use HTTPS in production
- JWT tokens expire after 24 hours
- Rate limiting: 100 requests per minute per IP
- Input validation on all endpoints
- SQL injection protection via parameterized queries
- CORS configured for specific origins only

fields.name: PERFORMANCE_NOTES
fields.label: Performance Notes
fields.placeholder:
## Performance Characteristics

- Response times: < 100ms for most endpoints
- Throughput: 1000+ requests/second
- Database connection pooling enabled
- Redis caching for frequently accessed data
- Pagination implemented for large datasets
- Database indexes optimized for common queries

fields.name: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
fields.label: Acknowledgments
fields.placeholder:
- [Express.js](https://expressjs.com/) - Web framework
- [Prisma](https://www.prisma.io/) - Database ORM
- [JWT](https://jwt.io/) - Authentication tokens
- [Redis](https://redis.io/) - Caching layer

fields.name: USAGE_INSTRUCTIONS
fields.label: Usage Instructions
fields.placeholder:
1. **Sign up** - Create your account using email or social login
2. **Setup Profile** - Complete your profile information
3. **Explore Features** - Navigate through the main features
4. **Sync Data** - Your data syncs automatically across all devices
5. **Offline Mode** - The app works offline and syncs when connected

fields.name: API_INTEGRATION
fields.label: API Integration
fields.placeholder:
The app integrates with our REST API for data synchronization:

- **Base URL**: `https://api.example.com/v1`
- **Authentication**: JWT tokens
- **Offline Support**: Local caching with sync on reconnection
- **Real-time Updates**: WebSocket connections for live data

fields.name: NATIVE_FEATURES
fields.label: Native Features
fields.placeholder:
### Platform-Specific Features

**iOS:**
- Face ID / Touch ID authentication
- iOS Shortcuts integration
- Apple Watch companion app

**Android:**
- Fingerprint authentication
- Android widgets
- Wear OS support

**Desktop:**
- System tray integration
- File system access
- Keyboard shortcuts

fields.name: TESTING_INSTRUCTIONS
fields.label: Testing Instructions
fields.placeholder:
Our testing strategy includes:

- **Unit Tests**: Component and function testing
- **Integration Tests**: API and database integration
- **E2E Tests**: Complete user workflow testing
- **Device Testing**: Physical device testing on multiple platforms

fields.name: PLATFORM_TEST_COMMANDS
fields.label: Platform Test Commands
fields.placeholder:
npm run test:ios     # iOS unit tests
npm run test:android # Android unit tests
npm run test:e2e     # End-to-end tests

fields.name: DEPLOYMENT
fields.label: Deployment Instructions
fields.placeholder:
### App Store Deployment

**iOS App Store:**
1. Build release version: `npm run build:ios-release`
2. Archive in Xcode
3. Upload via App Store Connect

**Google Play Store:**
1. Generate signed APK: `npm run build:android-release`
2. Upload via Google Play Console

**Desktop Distribution:**
1. Build installers: `npm run build:desktop-all`
2. Code sign applications
3. Distribute via website or stores

fields.name: STORE_LINKS
fields.label: App Store Links
fields.placeholder:
📱 **Mobile Apps:**
- [iOS App Store](https://apps.apple.com/app/your-app)
- [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=your.app)

💻 **Desktop Apps:**
- [Microsoft Store](https://www.microsoft.com/store/apps/your-app)
- [Mac App Store](https://apps.apple.com/app/your-app)
- [Snap Store](https://snapcraft.io/your-app)
fields.help: Links to published apps in various stores

fields.name: ARCHITECTURE
fields.label: Architecture
fields.placeholder:
The app follows a **Clean Architecture** pattern:

```
├── presentation/     # UI components and screens
├── domain/          # Business logic and entities
├── data/            # Data sources and repositories
├── shared/          # Platform-agnostic code
└── platform/        # Platform-specific implementations
```

**Key Principles:**
- Separation of concerns
- Dependency injection
- Testable architecture
- Shared business logic across platforms

fields.name: PERFORMANCE_NOTES
fields.label: Performance Notes
fields.placeholder:
**Performance Optimizations:**

- **App Launch**: Cold start < 3 seconds
- **Navigation**: 60 FPS smooth animations
- **Memory Usage**: Optimized for low-end devices
- **Battery Life**: Background processing minimized
- **Data Usage**: Efficient API calls and caching
- **Bundle Size**: Optimized builds for each platform

fields.name: TROUBLESHOOTING
fields.label: Troubleshooting
fields.placeholder:
### Common Issues

**Build Failures:**
- Clean build folders: `npm run clean`
- Reset dependencies: `rm -rf node_modules && npm install`
- Update platform tools to latest versions

**iOS Issues:**
- Clean Xcode build: `cd ios && xcodebuild clean`
- Reset iOS Simulator

**Android Issues:**
- Clean Gradle: `cd android && ./gradlew clean`
- Check Android SDK versions

**Performance Issues:**
- Enable Flipper for debugging
- Check for memory leaks
- Profile app performance

fields.name: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
fields.label: Acknowledgments
fields.placeholder:
- [React Native](https://reactnative.dev/) - Mobile framework
- [Flutter](https://flutter.dev/) - Cross-platform toolkit
- [Expo](https://expo.dev/) - Development platform
- [Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/) - Backend services
- [Figma](https://figma.com/) - Design collaboration
